extension.name: Conventional Commits
extension.configuration.properties.conve:
Controls whether the extension should automatically commit files.

When `#git.enableSmartCommit#` enabled and `#git.smartCommitChanges#` was set to `all`, It allows to commit all changes when there are no staged changes.

And set `#git.postCommitCommand#` to `sync` to run `git.sync` after commit.
Specifies which format will be shown in the `gitmoji`.
Controls whether the extension should prompt for a `gitmoji`.

Specifies which word will be treat as line breaks in the `body`.

Blank means no line breaks.
Controls whether the extension should prompt for the `body` section.
Controls whether the extension should prompt for the `footer` section.
Controls whether the extension should prompt for the `scope` section.
Specifies available selections in the `scope` section.
Controls whether the extension should show the commit message as a text document in a separate tab.
Controls whether the extension should allow keeping edit status after saving the commit message.
extension.sources.prompt.type.placeholde: Select the type of change that you're committing.
extension.sources.prompt.scope.placehold: Select the scope of this change.
extension.sources.prompt.scope.newItem.d: Add a new workspace scope. (You can manage scopes in workspace `settings.json`.)
extension.sources.prompt.scope.newItemWi: Use a new scope. (The scope will not be added in workspace `settings.json`.)
extension.sources.prompt.subject.placeho: Write a short, imperative tense description of the change.
extension.sources.prompt.body.placeholde: Provide a longer description of the change.
extension.sources.prompt.footer.placehol: List any breaking changes or issues closed by this change.
